definition: to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)

sentences.english: Users can write on the transparency as they wish, as private notes or public comments.
sentences.chinese: 批註可以是私人的，也可以對別人公開發布你的評論。

sentences.english: There are notes in the margin on every page.
The writ was indorsed with details of the plaintiff's claim.
sentences.chinese: 傳票上具體批註了原告的主張。

sentences.english: The ability submit notes and images by phone.
sentences.chinese: 你還可以通過手機批註和上傳圖片。

sentences.english: In his Vocabulary Building class, Peter tried to teach his students the different pronunciations of "car" in British English and American English.
sentences.chinese: 詞彙課上，皮特給學生批註了美音和英音的不同之處。

sentences.english: It also gives the interviewer something to take notes on.
sentences.chinese: 這也會方便麪試官做筆記或批註。

sentences.english: Please put down the remarks "Deck cargo at shipper's risk" in the Shipping Order.
sentences.chinese: 請在裝貨單上加“甲板貨由發貨人負責”的批註。

sentences.english: The writ was indorsed with details of the plaintiffs claim.
sentences.chinese: 傳票上詳細批註了原告的主張。

sentences.english: The paper came back, I saw the teacher Guo seriously making notes.
sentences.chinese: 試卷發回來後，我看到郭老師認真做了批註。

definition: to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
variant of 匯編|汇编[hui4 bian1]
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
to comment/a point by point commentary
